page.title: 02ATTRACTIONS OF GORING GAP
page.content: Within the area accessible via road and rail routes following the Gap there is a wide variety of tourist attractions. The Downs reach their highest point at 183 metres on the summit of{ {Lough Down,}owned by the National Trust. {Streatley}is a linear village with a busy junction where the main north-south and east-west roads cross, with two hotels and a youth hostel nearby. At this point travellers have forded the{Thames}for centuries and today is no exception as the river tumbles over weirs close to the double bridge built in 1922, where there is a constant flow of visitors attracted by the pleasure boats,lock,towpath walks and scenic views.
